html: When looking to @fema for disaster aid be sure to follow these steps: 1st - Contact your insurance provider to file a claim 2nd - Call 211 for any unmet needs 3rd - Reach out to FEMA. You can call 1-800-621-3362 or go to http://disasterassistance.gov  to register for aidpic.twitter.com/T6gdoLowJF
text:
When looking to @fema for disaster aid be sure to follow these steps:
1st - Contact your insurance provider to file a claim
2nd - Call 211 for any unmet needs
3rd - Reach out to FEMA. You can call 1-800-621-3362 or go to http://disasterassistance.gov  to register for aidpic.twitter.com/T6gdoLowJF

html: If you’ve received a message from your county emergency management office telling you to evacuate due to flooding... you need to do exactly that: leave. Emergency evacuation centers are open if you need a place to stay: https://scemd.org/stay-informed/emergency-shelters/ …

html: Due to the emergency flood situation in Georgetown, SCDOT will begin assembling a barrier wall on the US 17 bridge crossing the Waccamaw River at noon Sunday. US 17 will be restricted to one lane in each direction. Expect congestion and delays. Avoid travel if possible...
text:
Due to the emergency flood situation in Georgetown, SCDOT will begin assembling a barrier wall on the US 17 bridge crossing the Waccamaw River at noon Sunday.
US 17 will be restricted to one lane in each direction. 
Expect congestion and delays. Avoid travel if possible...

html: There’s so much water here in the Conway area that our pilots momentarily lost track of the river itself, the Waccamaw. It’s one of the ones officials are keeping a close eye on as water continues to flood into the state from upriver in NC. #Florencepic.twitter.com/wHwY2vBC71

html: At 5am, Florence is over eastern SC, and should continue to weaken as it moves farther inland today. It should become a tropical depression tonight. Life-threatening, catastrophic flash floods and prolonged significant river flooding remain likely over portions of the Carolinas.pic.twitter.com/0cspfDeTyg

html: More than 165,000 households are without power across SC due to #Florence. If you lose power try to use flashlights instead of candles. Never use a generator inside your home or garage. Keep it more than 20 feet away from your home, doors, and windows for safety. #scwx #sctweets

html: STAY FIRE SAFE When the lights go out, remember these tips: Use flashlights, not candles. Operate grills away from your home. Only use a generator if your home is designed for it. When using a generator, be careful where you store your fuel. #HurricaneFlorence #StaySafehttps://twitter.com/HorryEMD/status/1040669444383694848 …
text:
STAY FIRE SAFE
When the lights go out, remember these tips:

Use flashlights, not candles. 

Operate grills away from your home. 

Only use a generator if your home is designed for it.

When using a generator, be careful where you store your fuel. 

#HurricaneFlorence #StaySafehttps://twitter.com/HorryEMD/status/1040669444383694848 …

html: There’s good news, bad news and then the ugly. The good news is that #HurricaneFlorence has gone from a category 2 to a category 1, the bad news is that hurricanes are not wind events only. This is still a dangerous storm, take caution.pic.twitter.com/B9Fo95hKQg

text:
Attention Horry County:

html: #OnThisDay in 1963, Dr. King marched on Washington to deliver his “I Have a Dream” speech. Due to the brave efforts of him and so many other civil rights leaders, I am now living my mother’s American Dream. I’m grateful to serve the American people in the footsteps of giants.

html: While there is still much work to do, we live in a far different place from the 1960’s and that is something we should celebrate and rejoice. #MLK50
text: While there is still much work to do, we live in a far different place from the 1960’s and that is something we should celebrate and rejoice. #MLK50

html: My family’s story is a reflection of Dr. King’s determination and shows the progress he helped achieve. #MLK50
text: My family’s story is a reflection of Dr. King’s determination and shows the progress he helped achieve. #MLK50

html: He lived through Dr. King’s remarkable rise and personally saw the incredible influence he had on spreading equality. In one generation, our family went from cotton to Congress. #MLK50
text: He lived through Dr. King’s remarkable rise and personally saw the incredible influence he had on spreading equality. In one generation, our family went from cotton to Congress. #MLK50

html: My grandfather was born in 1921 in South Carolina, a very different time for race relations in our country. He left school in the 3rd grade to pick cotton, was forced to use a different water fountain, and had to use a certain side of the street. #MLK50
text: My grandfather was born in 1921 in South Carolina, a very different time for race relations in our country. He left school in the 3rd grade to pick cotton, was forced to use a different water fountain, and had to use a certain side of the street. #MLK50

html: It would be impossible to put into words the depth of the impact he had and continues to have on so many people, so I will leave you with a story. #MLK50
text: It would be impossible to put into words the depth of the impact he had and continues to have on so many people, so I will leave you with a story. #MLK50

html: Fifty years after his death, his words continue to inspire us to push forward and defy all obstacles. ‘If you can’t fly, run. If you can’t run, walk. If you can’t walk, crawl, but by all means, keep moving.' #MLK50
text: Fifty years after his death, his words continue to inspire us to push forward and defy all obstacles. ‘If you can’t fly, run. If you can’t run, walk. If you can’t walk, crawl, but by all means, keep moving.' #MLK50

html: “Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.” The Charleston shooter failed, and as the families of those killed stood with such grace and righteousness, your legacy shone as bright as ever. #ThankYouMLK50
text: “Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.” The Charleston shooter failed, and as the families of those killed stood with such grace and righteousness, your legacy shone as bright as ever. #ThankYouMLK50

html: When nine parishioners were killed at Mother Emanuel in 2015, the killer sought a race war. Perhaps at some point in our nation’s history, his plan would have worked. But not now. We are stronger from your teachings, more unified by your passion, & fortified by your words.
text: When nine parishioners were killed at Mother Emanuel in 2015, the killer sought a race war. Perhaps at some point in our nation’s history, his plan would have worked. But not now. We are stronger from your teachings, more unified by your passion, & fortified by your words.

html: There are obvious ways, such as the end of Jim Crow laws and the Civil Rights Act, but also ways we perhaps do not think about…ways your legacy has endured, even through tragedy. #ThankYouMLK50
text: There are obvious ways, such as the end of Jim Crow laws and the Civil Rights Act, but also ways we perhaps do not think about…ways your legacy has endured, even through tragedy. #ThankYouMLK50

html: But even though you were stolen from this world too young, your legacy endures. The change we have seen since you and my grandfather were born in the 1920s, not just in the South but across the country, has been massive. #ThankYouMLK50
text: But even though you were stolen from this world too young, your legacy endures. The change we have seen since you and my grandfather were born in the 1920s, not just in the South but across the country, has been massive. #ThankYouMLK50

html: Dr. King - I was just two years old when you were tragically killed in April 1968. You were born in the same decade as my grandfather, another black man born in the Jim Crow South. #ThankYouMLK50
text: Dr. King - I was just two years old when you were tragically killed in April 1968. You were born in the same decade as my grandfather, another black man born in the Jim Crow South. #ThankYouMLK50

html: #TaxReformFacts – Repealing the individual mandate means removing a tax mainly placed on those making less than $50k a year. The bill will not take health care away from anyone, it will instead actually expand the medical expense deduction. #WinForFamilies
text: #TaxReformFacts – Repealing the individual mandate means removing a tax mainly placed on those making less than $50k a year. The bill will not take health care away from anyone, it will instead actually expand the medical expense deduction. #WinForFamilies

html: #TaxReformFacts – Under the final bill, a single parent of one child, earning $41,000 will see a 73% reduction in their taxes next year. #WinForFamilies
text: #TaxReformFacts – Under the final bill, a single parent of one child, earning $41,000 will see a 73% reduction in their taxes next year. #WinForFamilies

html: #TaxReformFacts – Under the final bill, a typical family of four making $73,000 a year will see a 58 percent reduction in their taxes next year. #WinForFamilies
text: #TaxReformFacts – Under the final bill, a typical family of four making $73,000 a year will see a 58 percent reduction in their taxes next year. #WinForFamilies

html: #TaxReformFacts – Our bill will help families save for education by allowing the use of 529s for elementary, secondary and higher education. It also preserves current treatment of graduate student tuition waivers and the teacher deduction #WinForFamilies
text: #TaxReformFacts – Our bill will help families save for education by allowing the use of 529s for elementary, secondary and higher education. It also preserves current treatment of graduate student tuition waivers and the teacher deduction #WinForFamilies

html: #TaxReformFacts – The bill contains my Investing in Opportunity Act, which will incentivize long-term investment in distressed communities. #WinForFamilies #IIOA
text: #TaxReformFacts – The bill contains my Investing in Opportunity Act, which will incentivize long-term investment in distressed communities. #WinForFamilies #IIOA

html: #TaxReformFacts – We are helping families by doubling the child tax credit, and preserving the child and dependent care credit as well as the adoption tax credit. #WinForFamilies
text: #TaxReformFacts – We are helping families by doubling the child tax credit, and preserving the child and dependent care credit as well as the adoption tax credit. #WinForFamilies

html: #TaxReformFacts – It will help the working and middle class by doubling the standard deduction, and allowing folks to write off their state and local taxes up to $10,000 #WinForFamilies
text: #TaxReformFacts – It will help the working and middle class by doubling the standard deduction, and allowing folks to write off their state and local taxes up to $10,000 #WinForFamilies

html: #TaxReform will bring much-need relief to Americans across the country. In fact, the Senate bill helps teachers by increasing the teacher deduction to $500 so that teachers can buy more supplies for their students w/o using their own money. This is good news for teachers&students
